business.headline: Vodafone Idea shares drop 10%. Here's whyVodafone Idea share price: Over the last month, Vodafone Idea's stock has gone down by 16.73%. In the last year, it has fallen over 50%.

What's new in ITR Forms for FY 2024-25? 5 key changes you must knowNow taxpayers need to clearly mention the specific TDS section under which tax was deducted from your income. This change applies to ITR forms 1, 2, 3 and 5.

Supreme Court dismisses Vodafone Idea, Airtel plea on AGR interest duesThe court dismissed the writ petitions filed by the telecom operators, calling the move "shocking" and stating that the petitions were "misconceived."

Brent crude slips below $65: These stocks may benefit investorsBrent futures for July delivery were trading at $64.98 a barrel, down 0.66%. This is a steep fall from January, when prices were above $80 a barrel.

Once earning Rs 1.28 crore, metaverse engineer now sidelined by AI and delivering foodShawn Kay has worked in tech for 20 years. He was involved in virtual reality, web development and artificial intelligence. But after being laid off in April last year, things took a turn for the worse. The metaverse boom faded and jobs in that space dried up, especially with the sudden rise of AI tools like ChatGPT.

Dreaming of a job abroad? These are the easiest countries to get a work visaLatvia is the easiest country to get a skilled worker visa. It scored 7.64 out of 10 for ease of entry. The visa itself costs around 83 pounds and typically gets approved in ten working days, according to a study conducted by Remitly.
Explained: Why did Protean shares crash 20% todayProtean eGov Technologies, earlier known as NSDL e-Governance Infrastructure, provides technology solutions for various citizen-focused services.

India ousts Turkey's Celebi: $200 million lost in market-cap, jobs on the lineThe company, listed on the Istanbul Stock Exchange, saw its shares drop 20% in just two trading sessions. On 16 May, the stock fell 222 points to close at 2,002 lira.
Sensex opens 50 points lower, Nifty above 25,000; IT stocks down in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 36.40 points to 82,366.99, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 5.65 points to 25,014.15 as of 9:26 am.
Sensex, Nifty today: Key levels and sectors to watch. Here's how to tradeMarket experts say there is still positive momentum in the market, but traders should be cautious and focus on key levels.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty to open flat. Here's whyThe Nifty50 index gained 4.2%, and foreign investors bought shares worth Rs 15,925 l . Thast week. This was the fifth week in a row of buying by foreign portfolio investors.

Stocks to watch on May 19: Bajaj Auto, Delhivery, Dr Reddy's, JSW Steel, BELMany companies will be in focus due to their earnings and key updates, such as Power Grid Corporation of India, Bharat Electronics, DLF, ACME Solar Holdings, Bajaj Auto, Delhivery, Dr Reddy's, JSW Steel, etc.

Bengal to be impacted by Bangladesh import curbs, but nation first: OfficialsThe central government on Saturday imposed port restrictions on the import of a few Bangladeshi goods, such as readymade garments and processed food items.

India restricts Bangladesh imports through northeast check postsA wide range of Bangladeshi products will be restricted via the Integrated Check Posts in the northeastern states of Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram.

India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement: Final Phase Negotiations Aim For ConclusionUnion Minister Piyush Goyal will lead a team to the United States for trade talks. India and the US are working to finalize the Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA) by early July. The US President has proposed a trade agreement with India that would have no tariffs on a wide range of American products. The US President stated, 'India is one of the highest tariff nations in the world. It's very hard to sell into India.'

Adani drops Chinese lounge partner DragonPass: What it means for Indian flyersThe move, triggered by rising national security concerns, has ended DragonPass's access to Adani-managed airport lounges across the country.

Why the middle class is chasing expensive brands, explains market expertA market expert noted that nearly 75% of luxury spending today comes from the middle class, not due to rising incomes, but because of social media, marketing tricks, and peer pressure that fuel the urge to appear successful.

Indian traders' body boycotts Turkey and Azerbaijan over support for PakistanThe move comes after both Turkey and Azerbaijan openly showed support for Pakistan, at a time when India is facing sensitive national security challenges.

India-US trade deal: First phase likely to be ready by July 1, say sourcesIndia and the United States are in negotiations for a trade deal, with sources indicating that phase one could be ready by July 1st.

India to grow at 6.3%, ahead of China, US, and European Union: UN reportAccording to the UN's mid-year update of the World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP), India's growth is being fuelled by strong household spending and solid government investments.

Sensex slips 200 points, Nifty holds ground above 25,000; defence stocks surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 200.15 points to close at 82,330.59, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.30 points to end at 25,019.80.

2 IPOs to open next week: Check Belrise Industries, Borana Weaves detailsWhile Belrise Industries will open for bidding on May 21, investors can bid for the IPO of Borana Weaves starting May 20, 2025.

ITR filing 2025: Is July 31 your tax deadline? Find outFiling your return on time helps avoid penalties and delays in refunds. It also keeps your financial records in order. So, if your deadline is July 31, skip the last-minute rush and file in advance.

ITR filing 2025: Is digital Form 16 a game-changer for salaried taxpayers?Digital Form 16 is an electronic version of the traditional Form 16. It's generated directly from the TRACES portal, which is managed by the Income Tax Department. This means all your salary details, TDS, and tax-saving deductions are recorded accurately and match what the government sees.

Government clears 187 startups for tax relief. Here's what it meansTo qualify, the start-up must be recognised by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT). It should be a private limited company or a limited liability partnership and its turnover should not cross Rs 100 crore in any year since incorporation.

What Pakistan can and can't do with IMF loanThe International Monetary Fund (IMF) has approved a fresh loan package for Pakistan, agreeing to release USD 1 billion under its Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

Defence stocks extend rally on possible budget boost. What should investors do?The NSE Nifty India Defence index surged over 5% intraday on Friday. Cochin Shipyard and GRSE have been leading the charge, with the latter gaining a stunning 30% since May 13.

Singtel offloads 1.2% stake in Bharti Airtel in $1.54 billion dealSingtel, which has been an investor in Airtel for over 20 years, said its stake would drop to 28.3%, valued at around S$48 billion, from 29.5% previously.

Blaming NRIs won't solve India's housing problem, says investor. Here's whyNRIs earn in strong currencies like US dollars, pounds, or euros. So when they convert that money to rupees, they can afford much more. A house that seems expensive to someone in India may feel quite reasonable to someone earning abroad.

Cochin Shipyard, GRSE rally up to 12%: Why are these defence stocks rising?Cochin Shipyard jumped 12.51% to Rs 2,039 on the BSE at around 11:47 am, extending its rally for a sixth straight session. GRSE climbed 11.10% intraday to Rs 2,510, taking its cumulative gains to over 30% since announcing results post-market on May 13.

Stop all bookings to America, warns ace investor as Indians ditch TurkeyTourism to Turkey and Azerbaijan has already taken a major hit, especially after reports that Pakistan used Turkish-made drones in its recent strikes.

Borana Weaves IPO to open May 20: Check GMP, expected listing gainsAccording to grey market trends, the IPO is commanding a premium of Rs 55 per share, suggesting potential listing gains of over 25% for successful applicants.

Apple assures India manufacturing plans intact despite Trump remarks: ReportWhile Apple has not issued a public statement, sources said the company reaffirmed to Indian officials that India remains a key part of its global supply chain.

Explained: Why Yes Bank shares are in focus todayYes Bank stock: The shares fell over 1% in early trade but later recovered to trade in the green. At the start of the day, Yes Bank shares opened at Rs 21.50, slightly below Thursday's close of Rs 21.51.

Pakistan offers zero-tariff bilateral trade deal to US: ReportThe development comes shortly after US President Donald Trump claimed credit for brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, following four days of intense cross-border hostilities involving drones and missile strikes.
Explained: Why Bharti Airtel shares fell 3% in early trade today At 9:35 am, shares of Bharti Airtel were trading 2.69% lower at Rs 1,816.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

IndusInd bank shares down 2% after private lender flags interest mistakeIndusInd bank stock opened at Rs 735.95 after having closed at Rs 780.30 in the previous session. The shares have lost 7.29% in the past 5 days, 23.55% over the last 6 months, and 45.48% over the past year.
Sensex, Nifty open lower after yesterday's rally; IndusInd Bank down 3%The BSE Sensex was down 226.18 points to 82,304.56 at 9:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 67.80 points to trade at 24,994.30.

Stock market today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher. Here's whyBoth the Sensex and Nifty touched their highest levels in the last seven months in the last session. So far this week, the Nifty has gained around 4.5% and the BSE Sensex about 4%.
Stocks to watch on May 16: Hyundai, Airtel, IndusInd Bank, BHEL, Bajaj AutoHyundai Motor, BHEL, Delhivery, Emami will announce their earnings for the January-March quarter on Friday.

entertainment.headline: Indian-origin contestant's Raj Kachori impresses MasterChef Australia judgesChef Depinder Chhibber impressed MasterChef Australia judges with her Raj Kachori dish. The dish evoked strong emotions and highlighted rich Indian street food culture.

How actor Sumanth from Akkineni family carved his niche in Telugu filmsWhile most actors from legacy families chase mass appeal, Sumanth, who belongs to the Akkineni clan, has quietly carved a niche for himself with grounded performances and understated classics.

Suriya 46 begins with director Venky Atluri, actor Mamitha Baiju. PicsActor Suriya's next film, 'Suriya 46' with Venky Atluri has officially been launched with a puja ceremony. Telugu director Trivikram was present as a guest at the ceremony along with Suriya, Venky, Mamitha Baiju, Naga Vamsi and GV Prakash.

Kareena Kapoor skips Guns N' Roses concert, jams with Saif and Taimur insteadKareena Kapoor Khan skipped the much-anticipated Guns N' Roses concert in Mumbai to enjoy a heartwarming guitar jam session at home with husband Saif Ali Khan and son Taimur. Sharing the moment on Instagram, she proudly called them her "own band."

Tom Cruise hugs singer The Weeknd at MI: 8 premiere, fans call it unreal crossoverHollywood actor Tom Cruise and Canadian singer and songwriter, The Weeknd hugged at the Mission: Impossible – Final Reckoning premiere in New York. Fans recalled Tom Cruise's iconic lip-sync battle from 'The Tonight Show', performing The Weeknd's 'Can't Feel My Face'.

John Abraham's The Diplomat, and the 'no muscle-flexing' approach that workedJohn Abraham's 'The Diplomat' is anchored in realism and driven by restraint. The movie brings to life the remarkable true story of Uzma Ahmed and the quiet, calculated world of diplomacy that ultimately saved her. Read to know how the espionage drama delves into the behind-the-scenes operations of international diplomacy, where power moves quietly.

Exclusive: Rahul Bhat on challenges of shooting at Kumbh for his Hollywood debutRahul Bhat unveiled the first look of his Hollywood debut film 'Lost and Found in Kumbh' at Cannes Film Festival 2025. In an exclusive interview, Bhat spoke about the light-hearted comedy is set against the backdrop of the Kumbh Mela and promises a unique blend of Indian culture and humour.

Tom Cruise eyes Top Gun, Days of Thunder sequels: Thinking many different storiesActor Tom Cruise hinted at potential sequels to 'Top Gun: Maverick' and 'Days of Thunder' sequels. In an interview for the film, he said he is currently discussing 'many different stories'.

Guns N' Roses set Mumbai ablaze with a nostalgic, no-holds-barred rock spectacleAfter a 13-year hiatus, Guns N' Roses delivered a powerful and memorable concert in Mumbai, winning hearts with their classic hits. The band's energetic performance and crowd interaction made it a night to remember for fans.

Americans have no idea about Kashmir, India-Pakistan conflict: Vivek AgnihotriFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri, in an exclusive interview with India Today, spoke about the West's perception of the India-Pakistan conflict, and the Kashmir issue. He said we need to make more films about the Valley the way the US made on the Holocaust.

Ananya Panday makes it to Forbes 30 list, rumoured partner Walker Blanco reactsAnanya Panday has been named in the Forbes' 30 Under 30 Asia list for 2025. Her rumoured partner, Walker Blanco, celebrated the achievement with a supportive note on Instagram Story.

Neil Nitin Mukesh on daughter Nurvi's love for arts and Big B's filmsActor Neil Nitin Mukesh reveals his six-year-old daughter Nurvi's growing passion for the arts and admiration for Amitabh Bachchan.

Rapper Vedan's Kerala concert ends early due to crowd mismanagementKerala rapper Vedan's concert in Palakkad faced chaos due to overwhelming crowd turnout. Police intervened with lathi charge but confirmed no major injuries at the venue.
Abhay Deol turns DJ at Gurugram nightclub, fans call him 'lord Bobby's student'Actor Abhay Deol took over the DJ console at a nightclub in Gurugram. A video of his set has gone viral.

Will get fitting reply: Ravi Kishan's warning to Pak against 'terrorist activity'Actor and BJP MP Ravi Kishan talked about India's Operation Sindoor against Pakistan-backed terrorism, and highlighted that we will give a 'fitting reply' to our neighbour if they 'provoke' us.

Rasha Thadani recreates mother Raveena's iconic Tip Tip Barsa Paani at event. WatchActor Rasha Thadani stole attention after she recreated her mother Raveena Tandon's iconic hit 'Tip Tip Barsa' from 'Mohra' at an award show. The video of her performance has gone viral.

New beginnings: Singer Keneeshaa's cryptic post amid actor Ravi Mohan's divorceSinger Keneeshaa shared a poetry about 'noise' and 'new beginnings' on her Instagram page. This post comes days after actor Ravi Mohan called her companion in four-page note against his ex-wife Aarti amid divorce battle.

Kyunki... fame Achint Kaur asks for work, says actor's life has peaks and pausesAchint Kaur, known for playing Mandira in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', posted a video asking for suitable work opportunities as an actor and voice-artiste. She also mentioned that her profession has its highs and lows.

Urvashi Rautela is bewitching in black at Cannes, but fans spot wardrobe glitchActor Urvashi Rautela's black outfit at Cannes drew attention after a viral video highlighted a small tear in her dress. Despite the mishap, she earned praise for her fashion choice.

general news.headline: Sindoor ka saudagar: Congress steps up attack on S Jaishankar despite fact-checkRahul Gandhi once again reiterated his claims that India maintained silence over the loss of assets during Operation Sindoor, calling it a 'crime' to have informed Pakistan beforehand, while citing remarks made by S Jaishankar. Following his tweet, Congress leader Pawan Khera called BJP 'Sindoor ka saudagar' while playing Jaishankar's video byte.

Top court rejects Minister's apology for Col Sofiya Qureshi remarks, orders probeThe Supreme Court on Monday constituted a Special Investigation Team of three IPS officers to investigate the FIR filed against Madhya Pradesh Minister Vijay Shah for his communal and offensive remarks against Army officer Colonel Sofiya Qureshi.

A Bajrang Bali war cry and payback: How Rajput Regiment soldiers destroyed Pak postsIndia Today spoke to the Indian Army bravehearts stationed along the International Border in Jammu, who swiftly and resolutely countered Pakistan's attacks, inflicting heavy casualties and destroying enemy posts.

After Biden's prostate cancer diagnosis, questions about timeline, transparencyFormer US President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with advanced prostate cancer that has spread to his bones. Experts and doctors are debating how quickly the cancer could have progressed without earlier detection.

PK joins hands with former rival, gives Nitish Kumar jittersTwo of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's former aides -- Prashant Kishor and RCP Singh -- who had turned rivals, have now joined hands and are turning up the heat in the JD(U)'s backyard. With Singh merging his Aap Sabki Awaaz Party with PK's Jan Suraaj, they could shake up Kumar's core vote base and pile up pressure on Nitish's turf, Nalanda.

Pakistani 'spy' network busted in Haryana's Nuh, second arrest in 2 daysA Haryana man was arrested as the police busted a Pakistani spy network, marking the second arrest in two days in Haryana's Nuh, amid a spate of recent anti-espionage operations.
Allahabad High Court upholds Sambhal survey order, rejects mosque panel's pleaAllahabad High Court upholds Sambhal survey order, rejects mosque committee's plea

Indian-origin professor in UK loses OCI status over anti-India activitiesThe OCI status of UK-based Indian-origin academician Nitasha Kaul has been cancelled over "anti-India activities", driven by "malice and complete disregard for facts or history". The government notice was shared by Kaul, who was deported from Bengaluru airport last year within hours of her landing in India.

Pakistan targeted Amritsar on May 8. How India's air defence saved Golden TemplePakistan engaged in an air assault with aerial weapons, including drones and long-range missiles, targeting the Golden Temple, which was "thwarted" by the army personnel, who remained prepared for such situations and attacks.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Was on leave: Ola Krutrim on Bengaluru techie's 'suicide' due to work pressureKrutrim, an artificial intelligence unit of Ola, came under fire after a social media post claimed that its employee died by suicide due to toxic work culture and pressure.

US doctor stopped from boarding at Puducherry airport for carrying satellite phoneA 32-year-old US-based ophthalmologist was stopped from boarding at the Puducherry airport for carrying a satellite phone.

Scrap H-1B visas, deport holders, says Indian-origin politician, faces backlashRohit Joy, an Indian-origin Republican from Texas, sought the termination of the H-1B visa programme and deportation of its holders. Joy's remarks, which clashed with fellow Republican Rich McCormick's push for the domestic renewal of H-1b visas, earned him massive blowback. People were quick to remind him of his immigrant background.
The world is full of idiots, @grok is this true?What does a world where people have outsourced their thinking to AI look like? It looks like the one where everyone is groking all the time.

Elon Musk reacts after his mother shares results of his 1989 computer aptitude testThe document, dated May 17, 1989, was issued by the University of Pretoria, where Elon Musk studied for a short period before moving to Canada at the age of 17.
Hyundai i20 gets new Magna Executive variant, priced at Rs 7,50,900The Hyundai i20 rivals the likes of the Maruti Suzuki Baleno, Tata Altroz and Toyota Glanza.

ED arrests UCO Bank ex-chairman Subodh Goel in Rs 6,210 crore fraud caseThe ED arrested former UCO Bank chairman Subodh Kumar Goel in a Rs 6,210 crore bank fraud case linked to Concast Steel and Power Limited.

Top court to hear plea of professor arrested over Op Sindoor post tomorrowAppearing on behalf of Ashoka University professor, Ali Khan Mahmudabad, senior advocate Kapil Sibal said that the professor was arrested for an 'entirely patriotic statement on Operation Sindoor.'

India won't play or host Asia Cup 2025 amid Pakistan tensions: SourcesIndia has decided not to play or host the Asia Cup this year amidst tensions with Pakistan, sources told India Today on Monday, May 19. The Women's Emerging Teams Asia Cup, which was slated to be held in June, has reportedly been cancelled.

Trinamool's Yusuf Pathan snubs government's Op Sindoor delegation inviteTrinamool Congress MP Yusuf Pathan has declined to join the Operation Sindoor foreign outreach delegation, after the government named him allegedly without consulting his party.
Will resign if..: Himanta Sarma doubles down on Pak charge against Gaurav GogoiSarma claimed that Gogoi went to Pakistan at the invitation of Pakistan's spy agency Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI).

sports.headline: Frustrated Rishabh Pant isn't the captain that LSG will want: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra said that a frustrated and angry Rishabh Pant isn't something that LSG wants as they enter a crucial period in the play-off race. LSG need to win all their remaining matches to stand a chance of making it to the play-offs.

Moeen Ali reveals his parents were in PoK during India-Pakistan conflictFormer England all-rounder Moeen Ali has revealed that his parents were stranded in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) while he was in India earlier this month during a period of rising military tensions with Pakistan.

SRH won't use break as excuse ahead of LSG clash: Coach Daniel VettoriSunrisers Hyderabad head coach Daniel Vettori made it clear that the team won't use their extended break as an excuse ahead of their clash against Lucknow Super Giants on May 19. While both teams return after the break, SRH will play for pride, and LSG will fight to keep their fading playoff hopes alive.

Neeraj Chopra is free to push his limits after breaching 90m mark: Gagan NarangGagan Narang feels that Neeraj Chopra is now free to push his limits after breaking the 90-metre barrier during the Doha Diamond League on May 16. Neeraj finished second at the Diamond League in Doha but was finally able to get the monkey off his back.

IPL 2025: RCB replace Lungi Ngidi with Zimbabwe pacer ahead of playoffsRCB have replaced Lungi Ngidi with Zimbabwe pacer Blessing Muzurabani ahead of the IPL 2025 play-offs on Monday, May 19. The replacement will come into effect on May 26 when Ngidi will leave to join the South Africa squad for the WTC final.

Ben Stokes quits alcohol during injury rehab to stay fit for India seriesBen Stokes revealed he quit alcohol in January to speed up his recovery from a hamstring injury. With major series against India and Australia looming, the England captain made fitness his top priority during rehabilitation.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
